Reviews.Title: “C'est manifique!”
Reviews.Author: Mary Jane T
Reviews.Content: We booked the chambre Superieur 6 months before our trip. One king bed in a separate room; a day bed/sofa and a roll-away in the extremely spacious living room slept and comforted 4 happy travelers with class and style. Room had private terrase. We felt like French royalty in our penthouse apartment; fully equipped kitchen and private elevator/street access included. Wonderful service and great value in a superb location. Vive l' France!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: hmamsterdam
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Hotel de L'Arcade. We secured a good rate through booking.com and thought we'd give it a try. It turned out to be a wonderful surprise. The hotel is elegant inside and out, and in a terrific location. It's close to Rue St Honore, Place de la Madeleine, the Opera and the big department stores. Although it's a 3 star hotel, it exudes a 4 star rating. We booked a duplex, with a queen-sized bed upstairs and a convertible sofa (pulled out and fully made up) downstairs. Flat screen TVs on both floors, efficient bathroom with big bathtub, balcony on bottom floor. Staff polite and helpful. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + good value”
Reviews.Author: Trip-lover-forever
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go to Paris and want to stay in a convenient location without spending a lot, I choose Hotel de l'Arcade. Among Place de la Madelaine, Rue Saint Honore and Les Grands Magasins, it is the perfect location for shopping, enjoying the center of Paris, but also go anywhere easily, since there are plenty of metro stations around. Its rooms are pleasant, clean and comfortable. The breakfast is tasteful, offering fresh coffee, french croissants, bread and cheese and everything you need to keep you going during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: Philip0010
Reviews.Content: Saves you a lot of time in visiting Paris .Went before to hotel James which is also great except it is not central.Agree with all the positive comments here and the only minus "breakfast".We took Paul in the neighbourhood for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A really good boutique hotel next to St Honore”
Reviews.Author: Paty_greece
Reviews.Content: A spacious boutique hotel next to Place de la Madeleine and to Saint Honore, clean,smart rooms. The service is good ,not perfect, except the man that is working in the night at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “October in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CALTraveler199
Reviews.Content: My husband, niece and I stayed at the Hotel de l'Arcade the last week of October this year as part of a celebration of our niece's graduation from college. We were completely delighted with the ambiance, the location, the amenities and the staff-- especially the concierge service. We were close to favorite places to visit-- the Rue de Rivoli and the Marais, as well as new ones, and we were close to great restaurants, cafes and wine shops, including Fauchon, Cafe Madeleine, Cafe Illy and Angelina's. We loved the two suites we had - one for us and one for our niece. The suites were lovely and were across a private foyer, which provided privacy and ease of getting together. Our suite was large enough for the three of us to dine (each suite had a small kitchen), visit and check email together. We also really appreciated the free wi fi, something that not even the larger hotel chains provide. The location of the hotel was on a quiet street, and we could easily get to everywhere we wanted to go, either by walking or by taking a close-by Metro. We look forward to a return visit to Paris and the Hotel de l'Arcade.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownHelen
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I spent two amazing nights here. The hotel is really well priced for what you get. And we had a fantastic room on the top floor in the corner, with a long balcony that wrapped right around the corner with views of the streets below. Staff were helpful and friendly and it's in a convenient location. I will definitely stay here again when I'm next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: Firstclasslad
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel and absolutely loved it. The service is polished, professional and friendly and the location could not have been better. Situated in a side street a stoneâ€™s throw from the Madeleine metro station this is the perfect place to stay in order to explore Paris. The side street can seem busy during the day but I heard no noise at night. Place de la Concorde is a few minutes walk along with gorgeous gourmet food shops, cafes, restaurants and the high-end designer shops. Galleries Lafayette & Printemps are also only a few minutes away. The hotel itself is a peaceful haven. Very clean rooms with comfortable beds, a safe, good shower, air-conditioning and a flat screen TV. There is so much of this hotel that deserves more than its official 3 Star rating. Breakfast was lovely, such a fantastic selection of breads & nice pastries. I wouldnâ€™t stay anywhere else in Paris now and would highly recommend this hotel â€“ thank you to the management Viviane & Jeremy for making it a very memorable stay. If you want a value for money, well-located personal hotel then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie g
Reviews.Content: This is our favourite hotel to stay in Paris as it is a great location, small & friendly staff. The rooms are standard size but nicely decorated with all that you need to enjoy your stay. The entry is very welcoming & the staff are very helpful. The bathrooms are small & possibly still have old plumbing ( as the flush on the toilet needed to be held in ) but still very presentable & very clean. There is a small breakfast room which is very cute however as there are many patissieres close by this is a much cheaper option. The hotel has been renovated recently & the new appartments are stunning, however the older rooms have also been renovated & are more than nice enough although much smaller. This hotel is very good value for money & as we visit Paris twice a year is the only hotel we will stay at after trying many other options.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean hotel in a wonderful area”
Reviews.Author: HealthInspektor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel de l'Arcade three times while caring for three young children. The hotel itself was wonderful. The rooms were clean and quiet with nice street views. The windows actually opened for fresh air! Unheard of in the US. The beds were comfortable. The location is great. During the day, the kids and I wandered around enjoying the neighborhood's restaurants and shops. At night, I felt safe enough to be by myself. This is a lovely little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerPGH
Reviews.Content: We spent four night at Hotel de l'Arcade in August, in a triple room on the top floor. The triple room was perfect for us, as it had both a king bed and a single bed. The two beds are partially separate by a wall, which provided a nice bit of privacy and a sense of greater space. The room itself was nicely appointed, and was a good size. We easily fit three people and a lot of suitcases without tripping over one another. We had a lovely view out the window, over our narrow balcony, at the surrounding buldings and down the street. The hotel is on the corner, and the narrow side street (not Rue de l'Arcade) had a fair amount of traffic. However, traffic noise was not a problem. The AC kept the room nice and cool during the unusually hot August days while we were there. The bathroom was fairly spacious, and the room was overall clean and well-cared for. The beds were reasonably comfortable. You wouldn't confuse the hotel with a luxury five star, but it was more than comfortable enough. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful, including the manager Jeremy in particular. We had one issue with a rattling air conditioner, and it took the staff two tries before the problem was addressed. Overall, however, it was service with a smile and we felt well taken care of. We can't comment on the breakfast, because we choose to pick up some pastries, and some champagne and orange juice, and ate in the room while enjoying the view over the balcony. The location, as many of the other reviews have noted, is wonderful. Easy walking distance to multiple Metro stops, as well as a central location with good access to many Paris highlights in each direction. The closest Metro, at Madeliene, had three lines, making it easy to get most places with at most one transfer. For those who haven't been on it, the Metro is quick, clean, well marked and easy to figure out, with rarely a wait of more than a few minutes to get a train.

Reviews.Title: “If this is what you want â€“ I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Frenchchic
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™re looking for a nice, fairly priced, basic hotel, one that is clean, with a good bed, an adequate breakfast, friendly staff and excellent location, then I heartily recommend this hotel. After years of staying at the Hotel Castille on rue Cambon, rising prices and declining service motivated us to choose a new hotel. We wanted to stay somewhere in the same area. After reading Trip Advisor reviews, we decided on Lâ€™Arcade. If anything Lâ€™Arcadeâ€™s location is even better. Itâ€™s close to everything and a Metro station is literally, right around the corner. The staff is very helpful, friendly and smiling, we appreciated that. Nowâ€¦what it is not. My husband and I visit Paris often, so for us this isnâ€™t a once in a lifetime kind of trip. If it were my one credit-card-limit-blowing dream trip to Paris, I donâ€™t know that I would suggest this hotel. It is not luxurious. The bed is satisfactory, but thereâ€™s no duvet to sink into, no plush bathrobes, no designer dÃ©cor, no whirlpool tub for two. If thatâ€™s the kind of thing you have your heart set on, then Iâ€™d look elsewhere. For us though, Paris weekenders, itâ€™s just fine. My one complaint â€“ no alarm clock in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbara888Queenstown
Reviews.Content: We loved our apartment, beautiful outlook, clean and comfortable. The rear entrance which led immediately to the apartment was very easy, just didnt allow us to make that contact with the staff. Unfortunately the hotel forgot to order our airport taxi which made our last few hours in Paris a pretty anxious time but other than that a lovely place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff brilliant hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: 186364Kate
Reviews.Content: I came to watch tour de France with my sister, and stayed 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. We were given an appartment which was clean comfortable and felt very cosy. This hotel made our trip one to remember and i wouldn't go anywhere else in Paris now. Thanks to all the staff, especially Jeremie, the front desk manager for looking after us so well.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed We Didn't Get to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: h2obury21
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Paris we were really excited to check into our hotel, so imagine our surprise when we got here, they showed that we had cancelled our reservation. I explained to the staff that we cancelled one room type and rebooked another (which we had a confirmation for). They apologized and said there was some confusion and they cancelled our entire reservation. I was very disappointed that they didn't call to clear up the confusion as we were really looking forward to staying here, and this was not how we wanted to start our vacation. The hotel was full so they set us up at their sister hotel. We really appreciated the extra effort, but I was surprised that they didn't offer us a discounted rate, or breakfast...something for the mix-up.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Midauer
Reviews.Content: The concierge was wonderful, always helping us a lot! The hotel itself is very clean and beautiful! Perfect place to stay: just a few blocs from Champs ElysÃ©es. We strongly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaC28
Reviews.Content: This was a really wonderful hotel - one of the nicest stays we had on our trip to Europe, which included 7 different hotels. We stayed in a suite, which we found to be priced only slightly more than what we had planned to spend on a regular room in Paris (given the average cost of a nice room in Paris.) I know there are two sections to the hotel â€“ â€œoldâ€� and â€œnewâ€� and we were in the new section. The suite was new enough to be in perfect condition but still felt quite traditionally â€œFrench.â€� It was nicely furnished with a small kitchenette (that we never used, but was nice to have the small refrigerator.) The bathroom was beautiful , luxurious even, and very functional. The wireless internet connection was good and free of charge. The room was quiet and the location was good. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and all spoke English. We wouldnâ€™t hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Paris_Hongkong
Reviews.Content: First i have to say that as a parisian, i know the city and its standards very well. The Hotel de L'Arcade couldn't be better: close to everything, you can walk easily to Louvre museum, Jardin des Tuileries, Concorde, shopping malls Galeries Lafayette and Printemps, Opera, or just to the river Seine. The Champs Elysees aren't too far either. So the main great point of this hotel is it prime location in the center of the city. The hotel itself is very neat, clean, and elegant in a french way but without overdoing it (don't expect anything super luxury either): it was actually refurbished a few years ago. We had two rooms which were both nice. My wife's parents had one of the 'special' suite, which was very beautiful with a painting on the ceiling, a little living room area, a kitchenette. It's located in a very calm street as well, so you can enjoy a quiet and sound sleep. The staffs were very friendly and always eager to help us with anything, and they also spoke pretty good english. They helped us with bookings such as Versailles palace visit, taxis, restaurants, river cruise, Lido and all went fine. As a note there is a pretty good italian restaurant just a few meters away (even though it doesn't look that great from outside). In Paris, this hotel is an excellent 3 stars hotel with a good value for money: it's actually much better than some 4 stars rated hotels in the french capital city (even in the same area), being in terms of service, location, cleanliness, rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Apartments Ideal for family with Young child”
Reviews.Author: FranceMauritius
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one apartment of the Hotel de l'Arcade which was really the most convenient choice we could make. We had a very spacious room with a huge bathroom/shower and separate toilet and a small lounge separated by a door which made our room private while our child slept on the sofa which was set up as bed every evening. The service in the room perfect. The Kitchenette very practical for young kids while having the full hotel service. Only facility missing a restaurant within the hotel, but as in Paris there is such a wide choice of excellent restaurants, it is not a drawback. the choice for breakfast is also limited but good.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CanadianinParis_10
Reviews.Content: We are three friends who enjoyed a respite away from busy lives and families. The hotel is in a great location, easy to access with metro not far, lots of good restaurants nearby and close to shopping. We had booked a triple room and it was large (with lots of storage), spotless and the bathroom was extremely clean, up to date and of a good size. The front desk staff were very friendly and very helpful. Beds were not the most comfortable but were easily outweighed by all the other great aspects of the hotel. Great value! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Smilzetto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had a Great time!! Wide clean rooms, perfect location near Madeleine, Room service twice a day, free internet wifi. Honest price for Paris. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: oceangipsey
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 2 nights during September 2010 in 2 interconnecting rooms. The rooms were both fairly good sizes. We had breakfast both mornings in the breakfast room which was a buffet with plenty of croissants, rolls and ham/cheese, fruit, cereals, tea, coffee, hot chocolate and juice- very good value. There was free and fast wireless internet access at the hotel. The hotel was very central - walking distance of the Louvre, Place de L'Concorde, Galleries Lafyette, The Seine and Musee Dorsay. Three minutes walk to Madeleine Metro. Our rooms were very clean and serviced every day with new towels and toiletries replenished twice a day. On the negative side for me was: late night and early morning street noise and the mattress were too soft. But due to the great breakfast and price of the rooms I would most definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good reliable hotel in excellent position”
Reviews.Author: BillNoble
Reviews.Content: For Paris hotels it is very good. Expensive for what it is but then all Paris hotels are. The room was clean and comfortable. The location superb. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CharleneM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to France and Italy with our 3 adult children. Our first two nights were spent in this hotel in Paris. We had a double room in the new part of the hotel and our kids were in a triple in the original part. Our rooms were ready although we arrived early, but they do have a luggage drop-off if needed. Rooms are beautiful, exceptionally clean, and wi-fi is available. Beds are typical for Europe: very firm, but this is what we expected. All linens were excellent, and terry cloth towels were exchanged daily. Nice toiletries were provided. We had wash clothes the first night, but they were not replaced, so hang on to them. (Wash clothes are rarely provided in Europe, so this was a real treat.) Rooms came equipped with hair dryers and air-conditioning. The male staff is not rude, just very formal, but the female desk staff is very welcoming and helpful, really terrific. They never hesitated to call a cab, or give advice. Exhausted after visiting the Eiffel tower and the Place de la Concorde, we ate our first evening meal in Paris at Pompeii, which is just a block away from the hotel. Surprisingly good pizza and good wine selection. Very hectic, though, with typical French wait-staff attitude, which you learn to take in stride. It is owned by an Italian family, and they are more friendly. Breakfast is really expensive at the hotel, and nothing special. We walked down the street to the patisserie for some wonderful espresso, croissants and a great view of Parisians. It is across the street from Pompeii. On our second night, we asked for a restaurant recommendation for a contemporary French meal, not an easy task for a Sunday. A half-hour later, the desk person called to say that she had made reservations for us at La Cuisine and had arranged for a taxi to pick us up. We were so impressed by her thoughtfulness, and the restaurant was such a wonderful experience. I would say that our positive impression of our time in Paris has a great deal to do with this hotel, and will definitely stay here again. By the way, all of our taxi experiences were great, and we never saw an upcharge when the hotel arranged for it.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: djsmapping
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 nights -- first 2 nights work-related, then 3 nights for "holiday", and then came back for one night after a week elsewhere. The hotel is on a quiet street very near La Madeleine. There are two sections of the hotel -- the "old" part, a solid, attractive building that has been around a long time, and the "new" part, around the corner, with only two rooms on each floor, and with a private entry. There is fast wireless in every room, a good breakfast, lots of help available from the front desk for directions, reservations, suggestions, etc. The "old" part is not really well set up for business travel, but I managed; the rooms are comfortable, the beds lovely, the views out to the street unforgettably Parisian. The final night, I was in the "new" section, and there the rooms are very modern, with lots of storage, and very large bathrooms. HINT: When you reserve, ask about a room on the top floor -- these rooms have small balconies (or in the case of room 508, a large balcony with outdoor furniture). Also good: only a few steps to the Madeleine Metro stop. If you are looking for 24/7 room service, this is not the place Breakfast in the room is a full breakfast if you wish, but for other meals there are Ã©piceries, boulangeries, and restaurants all around, and in every other aspect this hotel is one of my favorites in the world (and for the record, I average 150 hotel nights per year)

Reviews.Title: “First class service, superb location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TeessideLecturer
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel due to its location and the reviews available. On arrival we were welcomed by attentive, courteous and professional staff who seemed pleased to see us. We had two rooms a double and a triple - the triple room contained an additonal single bed which looked a little like a hospital bed which rather spoiled the overall look of the room although it was adequate for an adult. The towlels were changed throughout our 3 night stay and the complimentary toiletries replenished daily. The breakfast was plentiful and good - ours was included in the price. as for location it was a quiet area handy for the metro at Madeleine [Ave Tronchet] or Place de La Concorde - 3 and 6 minutes away respectively. 5 minute walk to the Opera - turn left from hotel and walk to the end of the street out into the Bld. Hausmann / Printemps/Galeries Lafayette and Opera. Always recommend the Latin Quarter for food and atmosphere, loved the walk from Arc de Triomphe down the Champs Elysees to the Place de La Concorde, stopping frequently for breaks and generally soaking up the ambience. The weather was bright, sunny if a little cool at times making a walk through the Tuilleries most enjoyable as well as a river trip. We have visited Paris on many occasions this one was to celebrate our daughter's special birthday and it didn't disappoint. Our party was myself, my husband and three grown up children. This hotel we would use again for its location, courtesy and high standards - the female reception staff were particularly welcoming and very obliging although the 'breakfast lady' was a little dour! We took a taxi from the hotel back to Gard du Nord for 5 people - 55 euros!!!!!!! The gentleman on reception was reluctant to book one for us suggesting we try the office at the end of the road - this was quickly remedied by one of the female receptionists. Nonetheless, we would recommend this hotel if you are looking for one that is is in a safe, good location with easy access to metro etc and is excellent value for the standards on offer.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable good , perfect as location”
Reviews.Author: deary2000
Reviews.Content: We have visited this hotel at the beginning of March and we've found a beautiful small hotel located close to Madeleine Church . Superb location to visit Paris . Everything was ok from the beginning to end with minor things which of course could be fixed - e.g bathroom should be cleaned with more attention ! One minus , instead , was the poor breakfast which considering what you can find out in other places for these money must be upgraded . Maybe the management will take care of this .....anyway , we can grant a 3 + stars. A must for you - visit the Maison de la Truffe ( few minutes walking from the hotel ) for a tasty lunch or dinner .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, convenient hotel with a warm, family run feel.”
Reviews.Author: Max_D-Fect
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews we found here on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. This is a lovely hotel on a quiet street just a few seconds away from La Madeleine. As everywhere is pretty flat you can easily walk down to Place De La Concorde or in the opposite direction to Galleries Lafayette. We did not feel uncomfortable or threatened at any time of day or night walking around this area. Having said that, after checking out the sites in the immediate vicinity, we spent most of our time on the other side of the Seine, visiting Notre Dame, The Pantheon, Eiffel Tower, Musee D'Orsay so just be aware that taxi fares to add up quite quickly in Paris, so plan out what you want to see and if the majority is the otherside of the river, you may want to consider somewhere over there instead depending on your budget! Here's a tip: If you call and book a taxi in Paris (even if the hotel call for you), they start the fare at a higher rate than if you flagged the taxi in the street. Generally a hailed taxi would start at 3.60 euros, however, one evening when we booked a taxi through the hotel, the fare started at 7.40 euros before we'd even gone anywhere! Just wander up to Place Madeleine and hail one there. That aside, back to the hotel. The staff were *really* helpful and friendly and gave this place a great family run feel to it. We asked for advice and to book taxis on various occasions and always found them very obliging. There's a nice foyer to sit and wait for taxis and it's all decorated to a classy, high standard. Our room was a standard double room up on the sixth floor. It was very comfortable, warm, quiet, and even had a little balcony. The bathroom was nicely decorated with a good shower and all meticulously clean. The room had a safe, but no iron/ironing board. The only downside we felt was the buffet breakfast. We thought it was quite overpriced at 13 euros per person for a very basic buffet. Unfortunately we could not find any nearby alternatives for breakfast and I think they capitalised on this a little. The juices on offer were a bit powdery and the croissants/rolls didn't seem that fresh. There was also a small platter of ham and cheese available and some fresh fruit salad, but not really worth the money. All in all we had a great time in Paris and we plan to return again. Oh, and one other tip: Pretty much all restaurants, cafes and shops close all day on a Sunday. So if you're planning on shopping, don't plan for Sunday!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Roberto_NW_Italy
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be better, a few steps from the Madeleine which means you can walk to almost anywhere in central Paris. Small three star hotel in quiet, clean road. We stayed in a 'duplex' room (i.e. two storey) that they propose to parties of three. King size bed upstairs, very comfortable, and sofa bed downstairs. Well appointed, LCD TVs, more than reasonable space (against the very tight Parisian standards), good breakfast buffet. Wholly satisfactory, deserves high Tripadvisor ranking because of value for money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and quality for its rates”
Reviews.Author: barranqtraveler
Reviews.Content: Have been several times at Paris, some of them staying in posh hotels like George V and Westin, and please do not take this for just a value hotel, this is a truly parisian small hotel with all the comfort of maybe a 4 star one, but with the price of a 2 to 3 star. I hardly believe you can find a better place in that range of rate. I booked there because of previous reviews of Trip advisor, and i join the group of the members that praise about his hotel. Location is as good as one can want, just 2 or 3 blocks from 5 star hotels like the Crillon and many others, lobby area is as elegant as any small 4 star in the area, and the rooms are very clean and well mantained, altough they have 3 star decor, they feel more than that because of cleanliness and excellent housekeeping job. Do not hesitate to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 2009 New Year in Paris”
Reviews.Author: carmenphilippines
Reviews.Content: When my husband announced that we are spending New Year in Paris, I immediately browsed thru the internet for a hotel. After reading the different hotel reviews at Tripadvisor I booked Hotel d l'Arcade with Venere.com. I chose this hotel for its near proximity to MTR, historic sites( Madelaine Church, Concord Place) and shopping areas(Champ Elysees, St. Honore and Gallerias Lafayette). My family and I were not disappointed. In fact, when we checked in, they gave us a bigger room, than what I booked for and without any additional cost. It also has a big bathroom. The room was cleaned everyday. The hotel staff were very helpful and attentive to all our needs. We also appreciated the chocolates that were given to us on New Year's Eve. We enjoyed celebrating New Year in Paris despite the very cold temperature and for Hotel d l'Arcade for making it memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Duplex room”
Reviews.Author: TravellerDeb60
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de l'Arcade was everything we hoped it would be. The hotel was very central - walking distance of the Louvre, Place de L'Concorde, Galleries Lafyette, The Seine and Musee Dorsay. Three minutes from Madeleine Metro. The room - a duplex with the double bed on a mezzanine floor and a single bed, armchairs, mini bar and bathroom below. It was the perfect solution to sharing with an 8 year old. As it was on the top (6th) floor it was very quiet. Breakfast (12Euros) was an eat all you like buffet pastries, toast, cereals, fruit, ham and cheese, tea, coffe chocolate and juice was good value compared with local cafes. My son inadvertently left his toy dog behind when we left. We phoned the hotel and they posted him back to us. He arrived exactly one week later beautifully wrapped in tissue paper. Fantastic service!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully comfortable & beautiful Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vv83
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Paris for his Christmas present, and chose to stay at The Hotel L'Arcade due to its fabulous location (right on the Place du Madeleine), about 10 minutes walk from the Louvre. Our room was in the new part of the hotel, and was perfectly quiet and lovely. It definitely had a more 4* decor than 3* decor! The furnishings were very high quality. I think the bathroom was the best bit, with a huge bath and shower which had plenty of hot water - lovely! The room had a kitchenette in it, and so I would think it would be a perfect place to stay if you were in Paris for an extended trip. We had breakfast both mornings in the breakfast room, which was a buffet with croissants and ham/cheese, fruit, cereals etc. There was plenty of it, and the waitress was very friendly and cheerful. All in all, this was a fabulous gem of a hotel, and having seen the way they are rennovating it, I am sure it can only get better. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jaffajames
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with a 3 year old. The location is awsome & the rooms great. We had an upstairs downstairs the 3 year old downstairs with own TV & lounge & us upstairs with own TV & we were able to look over balcony to see if she was ok. The room also had an outside balcony which we could go out onto, there were also shutters on the windows to make the room very dark. It had a bath & a shower & plenty of room for all our luggage & baby buggy. The breakfasts were very nice & also the staff spoke very good english. The location is great with wonderful restaurants just a few minutes walk away. Lovely safe area to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: botticini
Reviews.Content: This Charming Hotel is well placed in Paris, the staff was perfect and polite, the breakfast fantastic, my fourth time in Paris, and at same hotel. Ricardo Botticini Peres

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: setiferus
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel with a spacious room and 2 large windows overlooking the street. The best part of our visit to Paris was this hotel. Watch out for the pickpockets!! They are rampant. They got our camera out of a zipped bag that was attached at the waist. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They even made coffee for us at 6:30 am when we had a day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Quality for a 3-Star Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Trotwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice, two nights in late July and two again in early August, 2006 and was surprised by the quality of this well-situated hotel near La Madeleine. The room was large by Paris standards, the air conditioning worked well, the double-paned windows provided good sound insulation from city sounds for undisturbed sleeping and the bathroom was well appointed with a tub/shower and a shower curtain. Appears to have been subject of a major remodel and upgrade within the last 10 years but still well maintained and in good repair with only a few, minor exceptions that did not diminish the enjoyment of my stays. Staff were friendly and helpful. Lobby area was understated but very attractive as was the breakfast room, with the breakfast offerings above average and more than adequate. Only 41 rooms, so it has an intimate feel. Sister hotel to Hotel Bedford, a larger, 4-star property about 1/2 block up the street. Convenient location, only a very short walk to Madeleine metro station and with taxi stand close by. Quite comfortable and a good qualtiy/cost value.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable Hotel Near All My Personal Fav”
Reviews.Author: CaFlatraveler
Reviews.Content: Stay here whenever I can. Near friends and business or walk to shops or meetings. Clean, comfortable and easy to get on Metro, or did I mention shop. You can pay alot more and get alot less for your money in Paris. The staff is always helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly spacious duplex”
Reviews.Author: MaureenA99
Reviews.Content: The top floor duplex was beautiful, quiet and amazingly spacious for our family of three. The bathroom was fabulous too and there's lots of closet/drawer space. Each staff member was lovely, and they graciously accomodated our early check in request. This is a great neighborhood for walking. We easily walked to the departments stores, the Seine and the Louvre. The original Patisserie Ladure and Fauchon are also a short walk away. By far the best hotel we've stayed in the 8th. Also quite reasonably priced for this area. We've payed more for considerably less! Very quick walk to the metro and short walk to Opera for easy direct bus service to/from CDG.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, very pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: mel14
Reviews.Content: It is a pleasant small hotel, the room size is decent for a Paris hotel. It is clean, neat, and quiet. The colours in the lobby and the room are understated and demure. The staff was efficient and pleasant, especially in comparison to the lack of service ethos everywhere in big cities in France, which we found. They are professional and helpful. You can purchase a card for wireless interent use in your room. The TV is mostly in French. Bed was comfortable. There is airconditioning. Bathroom smallish but fine. The location is convenient - a minute walk from the Madeleine, very good for those who like the right bank and who wish to be closr to the great shops on Boulevard Haussman. We stayed for 3 nights in July 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Charming small hotel. Loved the breakfast room. C. L. of Cheshire.

Reviews.Title: “Neither disappointed or delighted with d l'Arcade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel's rooms and reception area has the look and feel of a luxury hotel, but it does not quite have the facilities to match, in my opinion. (Although admittedly my expectations were high.) Staff was pleasant enough, and spoke English well, so the hotel is perfectly adequate for a "ordinary" trip with a friend or relative, or for a business trip to Paris, but my boyfriend and I booked a week in Paris to mark a "special occasion" and felt that the hotel didn't have that little bit extra which the brouchure had promised us? (I have stayed in cheaper hotels with much more charm and character.) Conveniently located during the daytime, when we wanted to go shopping, but much less interesting at night: I knew when I booked the hotel that it did not have a bar, but from previous experience in Paris I thought it would not matter, as all other areas I have stayed in in Paris have had a typically Parisian bar on every other corner. This hotel is in a very quiet street, and although there are restaurants in walking distance from the hotel, there are no real good ones in immediate proximity. Having said that, I imagine that some would be perfectly happy with the hotel and location, especially more "mature" travellers. (I am in my 30s myself.)
